segment.source: About App-V 5.0 Reporting
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 Reporting

segment.source: About App-V 5.0 Reporting
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 Reporting

segment.source: About App-V 5.0 Reporting
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 Reporting

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 includes a built-in reporting feature that helps you collect information about computers running the App-V 5.0 client as well as information about virtual application package usage.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 includes a built-in reporting feature that helps you collect information about computers running the App-V 5.0 client as well as information about virtual application package usage.

segment.source: You can use this information to generate reports from a centralized database.
segment.target: You can use this information to generate reports from a centralized database.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Reporting Overview
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Reporting Overview

segment.source: The following list displays the end–to-end high-level workflow for reporting in App-V 5.0.
segment.target: The following list displays the end–to-end high-level workflow for reporting in App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Reporting server has the following prerequisites:
segment.target: The Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Reporting server has the following prerequisites:

segment.source: Internet Information Service (IIS) web server role
segment.target: Internet Information Service (IIS) web server role

segment.source: Windows Authentication role (under IIS / Security)
segment.target: Windows Authentication role (under IIS / Security)

segment.source: SQL Server installed and running with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
segment.target: SQL Server installed and running with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)

segment.source: To confirm SQL Server Reporting Services is running, view in a web browser as administrator on the server that will host App-V 5.0 Reporting.
segment.target: To confirm SQL Server Reporting Services is running, view in a web browser as administrator on the server that will host App-V 5.0 Reporting.

segment.source: The SQL Server Reporting Services Home page should display.
segment.target: The SQL Server Reporting Services Home page should display.

segment.source: Install the App-V 5.0 reporting server and associated database.
segment.target: Install the App-V 5.0 reporting server and associated database.

segment.source: For more information about installing the reporting server see How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database.
segment.target: For more information about installing the reporting server see How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database.

segment.source: Configure the time when the computer running the App-V 5.0 client should send data to the reporting server.
segment.target: Configure the time when the computer running the App-V 5.0 client should send data to the reporting server.

segment.source: If you are not using an electronic software distribution system such as Configuration Manager to view reports then you can define reports in SQL Server Reporting Service.
segment.target: If you are not using an electronic software distribution system such as Configuration Manager to view reports then you can define reports in SQL Server Reporting Service.

segment.source: Download predefined appvshort Reports from the Download Center at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=397255.
segment.target: Download predefined appvshort Reports from the Download Center at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=397255.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are using the Configuration Manager integration with App-V 5.0, most reports are generated from Configuration Manager rather than from App-V 5.0.
segment.target: If you are using the Configuration Manager integration with App-V 5.0, most reports are generated from Configuration Manager rather than from App-V 5.0.

segment.source: After importing the App-V 5.0 PowerShell module using as administrator, enable the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: After importing the App-V 5.0 PowerShell module using as administrator, enable the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: This sample PowerShell cmdlet enables App-V 5.0 reporting:
segment.target: This sample PowerShell cmdlet enables App-V 5.0 reporting:

segment.source: To immediately send App-V 5.0 report data, run on the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: To immediately send App-V 5.0 report data, run on the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: For more information about installing the App-V 5.0 client with reporting enabled see About Client Configuration Settings.
segment.target: For more information about installing the App-V 5.0 client with reporting enabled see About Client Configuration Settings.

segment.source: To administer App-V 5.0 Reporting with Windows PowerShell, see How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: To administer App-V 5.0 Reporting with Windows PowerShell, see How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: After the reporting server receives the data from the App-V 5.0 client it sends the data to the reporting database.
segment.target: After the reporting server receives the data from the App-V 5.0 client it sends the data to the reporting database.

segment.source: When the database receives and processes the client data, a successful reply is sent to the reporting server and then a notification is sent to the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: When the database receives and processes the client data, a successful reply is sent to the reporting server and then a notification is sent to the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: When the App-V 5.0 client receives the success notification, it empties the data cache to conserve space.
segment.target: When the App-V 5.0 client receives the success notification, it empties the data cache to conserve space.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default the cache is cleared after the server confirms receipt of data.
segment.target: By default the cache is cleared after the server confirms receipt of data.

segment.source: You can manually configure the client to save the data cache.
segment.target: You can manually configure the client to save the data cache.

segment.source: If the App-V 5.0 client device does not receive a success notification from the server, it retains data in the cache and tries to resend data at the next configured interval.
segment.target: If the App-V 5.0 client device does not receive a success notification from the server, it retains data in the cache and tries to resend data at the next configured interval.

segment.source: Clients continue to collect data and add it to the cache.
segment.target: Clients continue to collect data and add it to the cache.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 reporting server frequently asked questions
segment.target: App-V 5.0 reporting server frequently asked questions

segment.source: The following table displays answers to common questions about App-V 5.0 reporting
segment.target: The following table displays answers to common questions about App-V 5.0 reporting

segment.source: Question
segment.target: Question

segment.source: More Information
segment.target: More Information

segment.source: What is the frequency that reporting information is sent to the reporting database?
segment.target: What is the frequency that reporting information is sent to the reporting database?

segment.source: The frequency depends on how the reporting task is configured on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: The frequency depends on how the reporting task is configured on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: You must configure the frequency / interval for sending the reporting data.
segment.target: You must configure the frequency / interval for sending the reporting data.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Reporting is not enabled by default.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Reporting is not enabled by default.

segment.source: What information is stored in the reporting server database?
segment.target: What information is stored in the reporting server database?

segment.source: The following list displays what is stored in the reporting database:
segment.target: The following list displays what is stored in the reporting database:

segment.source: The operating system running on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client: host name, version, service pack, type - client/server, processor architecture.
segment.target: The operating system running on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client: host name, version, service pack, type - client/server, processor architecture.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Client information: version.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Client information: version.

segment.source: Published package list: GUID, version GUID, name.
segment.target: Published package list: GUID, version GUID, name.

segment.source: Application usage information: name, version, streaming server, user (domain\alias), package version GUID, launch status and time, shutdown time.
segment.target: Application usage information: name, version, streaming server, user (domain\alias), package version GUID, launch status and time, shutdown time.

segment.source: What is the average volume of information that is sent to the reporting server?
segment.target: What is the average volume of information that is sent to the reporting server?

segment.source: It depends.
segment.target: It depends.

segment.source: The following list displays the three sets of the data sent to the reporting server:
segment.target: The following list displays the three sets of the data sent to the reporting server:

segment.source: Operating system, and App-V 5.0 client information.
segment.target: Operating system, and App-V 5.0 client information.

segment.source: ~150 Bytes, every time this data is sent.
segment.target: ~150 Bytes, every time this data is sent.

segment.source: Published package list.
segment.target: Published package list.

segment.source: ~7 KB for 30 packages.
segment.target: ~7 KB for 30 packages.

segment.source: This is sent only when the package list is updated with a publishing refresh, which is done infrequently; if there is no change, this information is not sent.
segment.target: This is sent only when the package list is updated with a publishing refresh, which is done infrequently; if there is no change, this information is not sent.

segment.source: Virtual application usage information – about 0.25KB per event.
segment.target: Virtual application usage information – about 0.25KB per event.

segment.source: Opening and closing count as one event if both occur before sending the information.
segment.target: Opening and closing count as one event if both occur before sending the information.

segment.source: When sending using a scheduled task, only the data since the last successful upload is sent to the server.
segment.target: When sending using a scheduled task, only the data since the last successful upload is sent to the server.

segment.source: If sending manually through the PowerShell cmdlet, there is an optional argument that controls if the data needs to be re-sent next time around – that argument is DeleteOnSuccess.
segment.target: If sending manually through the PowerShell cmdlet, there is an optional argument that controls if the data needs to be re-sent next time around – that argument is DeleteOnSuccess.

segment.source: So for example, if twenty applications are opened and closed and reporting information is scheduled to be sent daily, the typical daily traffic should be about 0.15KB + 20 x 0.25KB, or about 5KB/user
segment.target: So for example, if twenty applications are opened and closed and reporting information is scheduled to be sent daily, the typical daily traffic should be about 0.15KB + 20 x 0.25KB, or about 5KB/user

segment.source: Can reporting be scheduled?
segment.target: Can reporting be scheduled?

segment.source: Yes.
segment.target: Yes.

segment.source: Besides manually sending reporting using PowerShell Cmdlets (Send-AppvClientReport), the task can be scheduled so it will happen automatically.
segment.target: Besides manually sending reporting using PowerShell Cmdlets (Send-AppvClientReport), the task can be scheduled so it will happen automatically.

segment.source: There are two ways to schedule the reporting:
segment.target: There are two ways to schedule the reporting:

segment.source: Using PowerShell cmdlets - Set-AppvClientConfiguration.
segment.target: Using PowerShell cmdlets - Set-AppvClientConfiguration.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Set-AppvClientConfiguration -ReportingEnabled 1 - ReportingServerURL http://any.com/appv-reporting
segment.target: Set-AppvClientConfiguration -ReportingEnabled 1 - ReportingServerURL http://any.com/appv-reporting

segment.source: For a complete list of client configuration settings see About Client Configuration Settings and look for the following entries: ReportingEnabled, ReportingServerURL, ReportingDataCacheLimit, ReportingDataBlockSize, ReportingStartTime, ReportingRandomDelay, ReportingInterval.
segment.target: For a complete list of client configuration settings see About Client Configuration Settings and look for the following entries: ReportingEnabled, ReportingServerURL, ReportingDataCacheLimit, ReportingDataBlockSize, ReportingStartTime, ReportingRandomDelay, ReportingInterval.

segment.source: By using Group Policy.
segment.target: By using Group Policy.

segment.source: If distributed using the domain controller, the settings are the same as previously listed.
segment.target: If distributed using the domain controller, the settings are the same as previously listed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Group Policy settings override local settings configured using PowerShell.
segment.target: Group Policy settings override local settings configured using PowerShell.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Client Reporting
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Client Reporting

segment.source: To use App-V 5.0 reporting you must install and configure the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: To use App-V 5.0 reporting you must install and configure the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: After the client has been installed, use the Set-AppVClientConfiguration PowerShell cmdlet or the ADMX Template to configure reporting.
segment.target: After the client has been installed, use the Set-AppVClientConfiguration PowerShell cmdlet or the ADMX Template to configure reporting.

segment.source: The reporting feature cmdlets are available by using the following link and are prefaced by Reporting.
segment.target: The reporting feature cmdlets are available by using the following link and are prefaced by Reporting.

segment.source: For a complete list of client configuration settings see About Client Configuration Settings.
segment.target: For a complete list of client configuration settings see About Client Configuration Settings.

segment.source: The following section provides examples of App-V 5.0 client reporting configuration using PowerShell.
segment.target: The following section provides examples of App-V 5.0 client reporting configuration using PowerShell.

segment.source: Configuring App-V Client reporting using PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring App-V Client reporting using PowerShell

segment.source: The following examples show how PowerShell parameters can configure the reporting features of the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: The following examples show how PowerShell parameters can configure the reporting features of the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following configuration task can also be configured using Group Policy settings in the App-V 5.0 ADMX template.
segment.target: The following configuration task can also be configured using Group Policy settings in the App-V 5.0 ADMX template.

segment.source: For more information about using the ADMX template, see How to Modify App-V 5.0 Client Configuration Using the ADMX Template and Group Policy.
segment.target: For more information about using the ADMX template, see How to Modify App-V 5.0 Client Configuration Using the ADMX Template and Group Policy.

segment.source: To enable reporting and to initiate data collection on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client:
segment.target: To enable reporting and to initiate data collection on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client:

segment.source: To configure the client to automatically send data to a specific reporting server:
segment.target: To configure the client to automatically send data to a specific reporting server:

segment.source: This example configures the client to automatically send the reporting data to the reporting server URL http://MyReportingServer:MyPort/.
segment.target: This example configures the client to automatically send the reporting data to the reporting server URL http://MyReportingServer:MyPort/.

segment.source: Additionally, the reporting data will be sent daily between 8:00 and 8:30 PM, depending on the random delay generated for the session.
segment.target: Additionally, the reporting data will be sent daily between 8:00 and 8:30 PM, depending on the random delay generated for the session.

segment.source: To limit the size of the data cache on the client:
segment.target: To limit the size of the data cache on the client:

segment.source: Configures the maximum size of the reporting cache on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client to 100 MB.
segment.target: Configures the maximum size of the reporting cache on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client to 100 MB.

segment.source: If the cache limit is reached before the data is sent to the server, then the log rolls over and data will be overwritten as necessary.
segment.target: If the cache limit is reached before the data is sent to the server, then the log rolls over and data will be overwritten as necessary.

segment.source: To configure the data block size transmitted across the network between the client and the server:
segment.target: To configure the data block size transmitted across the network between the client and the server:

segment.source: Specifies the maximum data block that the client sends to 10240 MB.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum data block that the client sends to 10240 MB.

segment.source: Types of data collected
segment.target: Types of data collected

segment.target: The following table displays the types of information you can collect by using App-V 5.0 reporting.

segment.target: Client Information

segment.target: Package Information

segment.target: Application Usage

segment.target: Host Name

segment.target: Package Name

segment.target: Start and End Times

segment.target: App-V 5.0 Client Version

segment.target: Package Version

segment.target: Run Status

segment.source: Processor Architecture
segment.target: Processor Architecture

segment.source: Package Source
segment.target: Package Source

segment.source: Shutdown State
segment.target: Shutdown State

segment.source: Operating System Version
segment.target: Operating System Version

segment.source: Percent Cached
segment.target: Percent Cached

segment.source: Application Name
segment.target: Application Name

segment.source: Service Pack Level
segment.target: Service Pack Level

segment.source: Application Version
segment.target: Application Version

segment.source: Operating System Type
segment.target: Operating System Type

segment.source: Username
segment.target: Username

segment.source: Connection Group
segment.target: Connection Group

segment.source: The client collects and saves this data in an .xml format.
segment.target: The client collects and saves this data in an .xml format.

segment.source: The data cache is hidden by default and requires administrator rights to open the XML file.
segment.target: The data cache is hidden by default and requires administrator rights to open the XML file.

segment.source: Sending data to the server
segment.target: Sending data to the server

segment.source: You can configure the computer that is running the App-V 5.0 client to automatically send data to the specified reporting server.
segment.target: You can configure the computer that is running the App-V 5.0 client to automatically send data to the specified reporting server.

segment.source: To specify the server use the Set-AppvClientConfiguration cmdlet with the following settings:
segment.target: To specify the server use the Set-AppvClientConfiguration cmdlet with the following settings:

segment.source: ReportingEnabled
segment.target: ReportingEnabled

segment.source: ReportingServerURL
segment.target: ReportingServerURL

segment.source: ReportingStartTime
segment.target: ReportingStartTime

segment.source: ReportingInterval
segment.target: ReportingInterval

segment.source: ReportingRandomDelay
segment.target: ReportingRandomDelay

segment.source: After you configure the previous settings, you must create a scheduled task.
segment.target: After you configure the previous settings, you must create a scheduled task.

segment.source: The scheduled task will contact the server specified by the ReportingServerURL setting and will initiate the transfer.
segment.target: The scheduled task will contact the server specified by the ReportingServerURL setting and will initiate the transfer.

segment.source: If you want to manually send data outside of the scheduled times, use the following PowerShell cmdlet:
segment.target: If you want to manually send data outside of the scheduled times, use the following PowerShell cmdlet:

segment.source: If the reporting server has been previously configured, then the –URL parameter can be omitted.
segment.target: If the reporting server has been previously configured, then the –URL parameter can be omitted.

segment.source: Alternatively, if the data should be sent to an alternate location, specify a different URL to override the configured ReportingServerURL for this data collection.
segment.target: Alternatively, if the data should be sent to an alternate location, specify a different URL to override the configured ReportingServerURL for this data collection.

segment.source: The -DeleteOnSuccess parameter indicates that if the transfer is successful, then the data cache is cleared.
segment.target: The -DeleteOnSuccess parameter indicates that if the transfer is successful, then the data cache is cleared.

segment.source: If this is not specified, then the cache will not be cleared.
segment.target: If this is not specified, then the cache will not be cleared.

segment.source: Manual Data Collection
segment.target: Manual Data Collection

segment.source: You can also use the Send-AppVClientReport cmdlet to manually collect data.
segment.target: You can also use the Send-AppVClientReport cmdlet to manually collect data.

segment.source: This solution is helpful with or without an existing reporting server.
segment.target: This solution is helpful with or without an existing reporting server.

segment.source: The following list displays information about collecting data with or without a reporting server.
segment.target: The following list displays information about collecting data with or without a reporting server.

segment.source: With a Reporting Server
segment.target: With a Reporting Server

segment.source: Without a Reporting Server
segment.target: Without a Reporting Server

segment.source: If you have an existing App-V 5.0 reporting Server, create a customized scheduled task or script.
segment.target: If you have an existing App-V 5.0 reporting Server, create a customized scheduled task or script.

segment.source: Specify that the client send the data to the specified location with the desired frequency.
segment.target: Specify that the client send the data to the specified location with the desired frequency.

segment.source: If you do not have an existing App-V 5.0 reporting Server, use the –URL parameter to send the data to a specified share.
segment.target: If you do not have an existing App-V 5.0 reporting Server, use the –URL parameter to send the data to a specified share.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The previous example will send the reporting data to MyShare\MyData\ location indicated by the -URL parameter.
segment.target: The previous example will send the reporting data to MyShare\MyData\ location indicated by the -URL parameter.

segment.source: After the data has been sent, the cache is cleared.
segment.target: After the data has been sent, the cache is cleared.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a location other than the Reporting Server is specified, the data is sent using .xml format with no additional processing.
segment.target: If a location other than the Reporting Server is specified, the data is sent using .xml format with no additional processing.

segment.source: Creating Reports
segment.target: Creating Reports

segment.source: To retrieve report information and create reports using App-V 5.0 you must use one of the following methods:
segment.target: To retrieve report information and create reports using App-V 5.0 you must use one of the following methods:

segment.source: Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) - Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services is available with Microsoft SQL Server.
segment.target: Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) - Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services is available with Microsoft SQL Server.

segment.source: SSRS is not installed when you install the App-V 5.0 reporting server.
segment.target: SSRS is not installed when you install the App-V 5.0 reporting server.

segment.source: It must be deployed separately to generate the associated reports.
segment.target: It must be deployed separately to generate the associated reports.

segment.source: Use the following link for more information about using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services.
segment.target: Use the following link for more information about using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services.

segment.source: Scripting – You can generate reports by scripting directly against the App-V 5.0 reporting database.
segment.target: Scripting – You can generate reports by scripting directly against the App-V 5.0 reporting database.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Stored Procedure:
segment.target: Stored Procedure:

segment.source: spProcessClientReport is scheduled to run at midnight or 12:00 AM.
segment.target: spProcessClientReport is scheduled to run at midnight or 12:00 AM.

segment.source: To run the Microsoft SQL Server Scheduled Stored procedure, the Microsoft SQL Server Agent must be running.
segment.target: To run the Microsoft SQL Server Scheduled Stored procedure, the Microsoft SQL Server Agent must be running.

segment.source: You should ensure that the Microsoft SQL Server Agent is set to AutoStart.
segment.target: You should ensure that the Microsoft SQL Server Agent is set to AutoStart.

segment.source: For more information see Autostart SQL Server Agent (SQL Server Management Studio).
segment.target: For more information see Autostart SQL Server Agent (SQL Server Management Studio).

segment.source: The stored procedure is also created when using the App-V 5.0 database scripts.
segment.target: The stored procedure is also created when using the App-V 5.0 database scripts.

segment.source: You should also ensure that the reporting server web service’s Maximum Concurrent Connections is set to a value that the server will be able to manage without impacting availability.
segment.target: You should also ensure that the reporting server web service’s Maximum Concurrent Connections is set to a value that the server will be able to manage without impacting availability.

segment.source: The recommended number of Maximum Concurrent Connections for the Reporting Web Service is 10,000.
segment.target: The recommended number of Maximum Concurrent Connections for the Reporting Web Service is 10,000.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
